resources.string: A clean, beautiful app for all your VALORANT agent needs
Explore all VALORANT agents and their unique abilities
Browse all weapons available in the VALORANT arsenal
Learn about the different ways to play VALORANT
Understand the ranking system in VALORANT

The ValorantInfo app uses three types of tests:
1. Unit Tests: - Test individual components in isolation - Located in src/test/java - Examples: AgentViewModelTest, AgentDetailsViewModelTest - Libraries: JUnit, Mockk, Turbine, Truth
2. Integration Tests: - Test interaction between components - Located in src/test/java - Examples: AgentRepositoryImplTest - Libraries: JUnit, Mockk, Turbine, Truth
3. UI Tests: - Test user flows and UI interactions - Located in src/androidTest/java - Examples: HomeFragmentTest, AgentsFragmentTest - Libraries: Espresso, Hilt Testing, JUnit, Mockk
To run tests: - Unit/Integration tests: ./gradlew test - UI tests: ./gradlew connectedAndroidTest - Specific tests: ./gradlew test --tests "com.example.valorantinfo.ui.viewmodels.*"
